cscie160.hw3
Class Elevator

java.lang.Object
  cscie160.hw3.Elevator

public class Elevator
extends java.lang.Object

Elevator Class will simulate the real world Elevator system. It has implementation to drop the passengers to their destined floors upon request.

Since:
- 10/28/2012
Version:
3.0
Author:
KALPAN

Constructor Detail

Elevator

public Elevator()
It will construct an Elevator at the first floor with no passengers on board and direction set to UP

Method Detail

move

public void move()
This method will move the elevator UP/DOWN each floor. If any passengers, destined for particular floor or if passengers are waiting on floor,It will stop the elevator.

stop

public void stop()
This method will stop the Elevator at current floor. It will calculate total no of passengers on board and will call unloadPassenger method to unload passengers from elevator to the floor. Then Prints the status of the Elevator and Floor

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
This Overridden method will print the status of the Elevator object. It will display its current floor, its moving direction and total Passengers on board along with their names.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

boardPassengers

public void boardPassengers(Passenger p)
                     throws ElevatorFullException
This method will board the passengers to the elevator. If elevator is at its full capacity it throws an exception

Parameters:
p - Passenger object
Throws:
ElevatorFullException - - When Elevator reaches its max capacity

registerRequest

public void registerRequest()
This method registers request to the elevator to stop at particular floor to board waiting passengers from the floor. Whenever this method is called it checks each floor for any waiting passengers and registers a request accordingly

getCurrentFloor

public int getCurrentFloor()
Returns:
the currentFloor

public void setCurrentFloor(int currentFloor)

currentFloor - the currentFloor to set

getCurrentDirection

public java.lang.String getCurrentDirection()
Returns:
the currentDirection

setCurrentDirection

public void setCurrentDirection(java.lang.String currentDirection)
Parameters:
currentDirection - the currentDirection to set

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Executing this main method will create an Elevator object at 1st floor and array of Floor objects. Take all the passengers from 1st floor. Move up going through each floor and then comes down. It will continue until all the passengers are released at their requested destination.
